text:
Sorry - this is a bit of a delayed response - but I think it depends.

If you're just looking at it from the financials, then it's just a discount. So if the discount has a positive impact on your overall sales velocity, then it's worth it. That's reasonably straight forward.

From a more holistic perspective, I think that nonprofits usually have less cash, but might give you the space you want to do meaningful work, or be in line with your values as an org, or create a referral / word of mouth network-y type impact, etc... For instance, I used to work at a UX agency who offered steep discounts for nonprofits because part of their mission and was to give back by offering their expertise at cost (bankrolled by bigger clients, of course).
